metadata.title: CVE-2009-1384 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: pam_krb5 2.2.14 through 2.3.4, as used in Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL)5, generates different password prompts depending on whether the useraccount exists, which allows remote attackers to enumerate valid usernames.

criterions.comment: libpam-krb5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
